content:
Diagnosis
	1. Descending colon adenocarcinoma, micropapillary subtype
	Initially pT3N1M0 at diagnosis January 2023
	Progressed with liver and bone metastases March 2024
	KRAS G12C mutation positive, BRAF wild-type

	Treatment aim
	Disease control

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2023 Left hemicolectomy

	Chemotherapy
	1. Feb-July 2023: Adjuvant CAPOX - 8 cycles completed
	2. March 2024: FOLFIRI - discontinued after 2 cycles due to progression

	Clinical studies
	ADORA-2 Phase II trial of MRTX849 (KRAS G12C inhibitor)
	Commenced 15 April 2024

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on first assessment

	Current issues
	Grade 2 diarrhea
	Mild fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today for cycle 3, day 1 of MRTX849 on the ADORA-2 trial. First radiological assessment completed on 20 May 2024 shows stable disease by RECIST 1.1 criteria with no new lesions identified. The largest liver metastasis in segment 7 measures 3.2cm (previously 3.3cm) and bone lesions are stable.

Tolerating treatment relatively well with grade 2 diarrhea managed with loperamide as needed. Reports 4-5 loose stools daily, improved from 6-7 at last review. Fatigue is mild and not impacting daily activities. No other significant toxicities noted.

Trial-mandated blood tests, ECG, and vital signs all within acceptable parameters. Performance status remains 1.

	Further investigations
	Next trial-mandated CT chest/abdomen/pelvis due 15 July 2024
	Monthly ECG monitoring as per protocol

	Medication prescribed
	MRTX849 600mg twice daily to continue
	Loperamide 2mg prn for diarrhea

	Follow up
	Next trial assessment in 2 weeks
	CT assessment in 8 weeks

	Required trial protocol actions
	Quality of life questionnaires completed
	Adverse event documentation updated
	Trial medication diary reviewed and compliance confirmed

	Summary of information given to patient
	Discussed stable disease status on first assessment
	Reviewed management strategy for diarrhea
	Provided next appointment schedule

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: KRAS G12C mutation positive, BRAF wild-type

cancer_timeline.value: Disease progression with new liver and bone metastases
Discontinued FOLFIRI after 2 cycles due to progression
Commenced ADORA-2 trial with MRTX849 (KRAS G12C inhibitor)
CT assessment shows stable disease by RECIST 1.1 criteria, largest liver metastasis 3.2cm (previously 3.3cm), stable bone lesions

patient_facts.value: Mild fatigue not impacting daily activities
Trial-mandated blood tests and ECG within acceptable parameters

status_updates.value: Metastatic colon cancer with liver and bone involvement, showing stable disease on KRAS G12C inhibitor trial therapy
Stable disease on first assessment with minimal change in measurable disease
Grade 2 diarrhea managed with loperamide, improved from 6-7 to 4-5 stools daily
Continuing MRTX849 600mg twice daily with good compliance
Next trial-mandated CT chest/abdomen/pelvis due 15 July 2024
